Legal_Issue: Whether the Board erred in concluding that the applicants failed to rebut the presumption of state protection in Mexico
Evidence_Type: Evidence showing Mexicoâ€™s protective apparatus was not wholly dysfunctional
Legal_Provision: Section 97(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Failure to demonstrate reasonable efforts to seek protection in Mexico
Application_Error: Failure to rebut presumption of state protection
Review_Outcome: No significant errors found in the Board's decision
Legal_Standard: Burden on claimant to show lack of effective state protection
Application_Factor: Functioning democracy with available state protections
Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada
Decision_Review_Issue: Existence of state protection in country of origin
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Rule: In a functioning democracy, claimants must prove they exhausted all protections or faced exceptional circumstances preventing them from seeking protection
Cause_of_Refusal: Applicants failed to adequately pursue protection within Mexico
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of evidence demonstrating attempts to access state protection in Mexico
Credibility_Issues: Implied lack of sufficient demonstration of efforts to seek protection
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to Board's conclusion on state protection
Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, sections related to refugee eligibility and state protection
Procedural_Issue: Standard of review on judicial review
